entry.def: A widower is a man whose wife has died and who has not married again.

means.word_mean: 1. a man whose wife is dead especially one who has not remarried

Sentence.sentence: The effect was first noted in 1858 by William Farr, who wrote that widows and widowers (鳏夫) were at a much higher risk of dying than their married peers.

If you tell an acquaintance you are a grandfather who recently lost his wife and who does volunteer work on weekends, several elements of your self-image are bought to light — the roles of grandparent, widower and conscientious citizen.
